intro: Tristaniopsis guillainii var. balansana, commonly known as the Balansana tristaniopsis, is a rare and endemic species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests, preferring humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, with a distinctive aromatic scent. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
